Job Title: Telco Billing Analyst - Washington, DC

Location: Washington, DC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Company  :

Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access and point-to-point transport services. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 216 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring. A generous base salary, structured tenure pay increases and an uncapped commissions plan offers you an unlimited earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment. Matching 401k and stock options are also included.

 Responsibilities  :

The primary responsibility is to receive and audit invoices from telecommunications providers of leased-line T1, T3, Optical and Ethernet services used for the provision of Internet access to customers. Compare invoices against company records to approve for payment or file dispute with the provider if necessary. Research and provide documentation to substantiate dispute/claim, such as notice of disconnect or proof of rate, and manage dispute to resolution.

 Scan hardcopy invoices using kwiktag  Attach soft and hard copies of invoices into the payment system  Process invoices for payments accurately  File disputes or claims in case of billing discrepancies and pursue resolution  Interact with various internal/external groups like Finance, Provisioning, Quote team, Cogent Billing, Vendor collections, Claim management etc. 

 Qualifications  :

Understanding of telco invoices for access and data products from providers such as AT&T, Verizon, Comcast, Level ( 3), etc. Must have an understanding of FCC and PUC tariffs ( CABS and CRIS), MSAs ( Master Service Agreements), USOCs, and billing components ( Channel Terminations, Mileage and Multiplexing) for access services.

Familiarity with Accounts Payable systems ( such as Great Plains) and associated AP terminology. Have the ability to produce reconciliation of invoiced amounts and payments applied on accounts. Assist in preparation of monthly accrual and cost analysis, as well as Sarbanes-Oxley monthly closing and audit tasks. Strong Excel skills and at least 3-5 years of experience in a similar position required.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
